org.fluidity.composition

Interface ObservedContainer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentContainer, OpenContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EmptyComponentContainer

    public interface ObservedContainer
extends OpenContainer
    A dependency injection container that exposes to application components the static dependencies in a dependency graph without instantiating components, and the dynamic dependencies while resolving and instantiating components. An ObservedComponentContainer instance works together with a client supplied ComponentContainer.Observer object that it sends component resolution events to.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   private final ComponentContainer container;
   …

   MyComponent(final ComponentContainer container, …) {
     this.container = container;
     …
   }

   public void exampleMethod() {
     final ObservedComponentContainer observed = container.observed(new ComponentContainer.Observer() {
       public void descending(final Class<?> declaringType,
                              final Class<?> dependencyType,
                              final Annotation[] typeAnnotations,
                              final Annotation[] referenceAnnotations) {
         …
       }

       public void ascending(final Class<?> declaringType,
                             final Class<?> dependencyType) {
         …
       }

       public void circular(final DependencyPath path) {
         …
       }

       public void resolved(final DependencyPath path, final Class<?> type) {
         …
       }

       public void instantiated(final DependencyPath path, final AtomicReference<?> object) {

         // will return the just instantiated object only after this method completes
         assert object.get() == null;
         …
       }
     });

     // static dependencies only; will invoke all methods of ComponentContainer.Observer except instantiated():
     observed.resolveComponent(SomeComponent.class);

     // static and dynamic dependencies; will invoke all methods of ComponentContainer.Observer:
     observed.getComponent(SomeComponent.class);
   }
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.fluidity.composition.ComponentContainer

        ComponentContainer.BindingException, ComponentContainer.Bindings, ComponentContainer.CircularReferencesException, ComponentContainer.InjectionException, ComponentContainer.InstantiationException, ComponentContainer.Observer, ComponentContainer.ObserverSupport, ComponentContainer.Registry, ComponentContainer.ResolutionException

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void resolveComponent(Class<?> api)
      Resolves the component bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them.
      void resolveGroup(Class<?> api)
      Resolves the component group bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluidity.composition.OpenContainer

        getComponent, getComponentGroup

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluidity.composition.ComponentContainer

        complete, initialize, instantiate, intercepting, invoke, makeChildContainer, makeDomainContainer, observed

    • Method Detail

      • resolveComponent

        void resolveComponent(Class<?> api)
        Resolves the component bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them. Dynamic dependencies, e.g., those resolved in component constructors will not be picked up by this method.
        Parameters:
        api - the component interface.

      • resolveGroup

        void resolveGroup(Class<?> api)
        Resolves the component group bound to the given interface and all dependent components without instantiating them. Dynamic dependencies, e.g., those resolved in component constructors will not be picked up by this method.
        Parameters:
        api - the group interface.
